status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"chhkm","text":"hiPSCs are maintained on Geltrex in mTeSR (Stem Cell) and passaged using 0.5mM EDTA, as followed by Virdi et al., 2022.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bdf52","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8teg6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"citation","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"align":"","authors":"Virdi GS, Choi ML, Evans JR, Yao Z, Athauda D, Strohbuecker S, Nirujogi RS, Wernick AI, Pelegrina-Hidalgo N, Leighton C, Saleeb RS, Kopach O, Alrashidi H, Melandri D, Perez-Lloret J, Angelova PR, Sylantyev S, Eaton S, Heales S, Rusakov DA, Alessi DR, Kunath T, Horrocks MH, Abramov AY, Patani R, Gandhi S","can_edit":true,"date":1669248000,"doi":"https://doi.org/10.1038/s41531-022-00423-7","guid":"C3BF3FC28ABF4EA29880418689D3026B","id":0,"journal":"","protocol_guid":"","protocol_id":0,"title":"Protein aggregation and calcium dysregulation are hallmarks of familial Parkinson's disease in midbrain dopaminergic neurons."}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d238v","text":"Neural precursor cells (NPCs) are obtained from hiPSC using the established protocol of ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"33hdu","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ae9a5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"citation","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"align":"","authors":"Shi Y, Kirwan P, Smith J, Robinson HP, Livesey FJ","can_edit":true,"date":1328400000,"doi":"https://doi.org/10.1038/nn.3041","guid":"C9F9FF107F4F44CE91D1368160437D45","id":0,"journal":"","protocol_guid":"","protocol_id":0,"title":"Human cerebral cortex development from pluripotent stem cells to functional excitatory synapses."}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5p8dr","text":"First, NPCs are induced by dual SMAD inhibition for 10 days, followed by culturing with the N2B27 media for another 15 days.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dsfrk","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6vpck","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fhjpf","text":"* how to make 1L of N2B27 media:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ersf0","text":"100ml DMEM:F12 + glutamax, 5ml N2 supplement, 0.25ml Insulin, 5ml Non Essential Amion Acids, 1ml 2-mercaptoethanol, 2.5ml Pen/Strep, 500ml Neurobasal, 10ml B27, 5ml Glutamax, 2.5ml Pen/Strep","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"472hp","text":"  ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7fq74","text":"* how to make dual SMAD inhibition media: 10uM SB431542, 1uM Dorsomorphin in N2B27 media ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"823ct","text":"NPCs are used to derive glial precursor cells (GPCs) by culturing in an N2B27 medium supplemented with 20 ng/ml of human FGF-2. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dkmb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eo7g4","text":"Cells are split twice per week (1:2 or 1:3) using Accutase (Cat No. A1110501, Thermo Fisher Scientific) by vigorously breaking pellets to remove neuronal cells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"jtim","text":"Upon the appearance of glial morphology (around day 90 from the neural induction), the GPCs are cultured for 7 days with 10 ng/ml Bone Morphogenetic Protein 4 (BMP4) and 20 ng/ml Leukemia inhibitory factor (LIF), which activates the JAK/STAT signalling pathway, refreshing the medium every other day","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6a94p","text":"On the 8th day, BMP4 and LIF are withdrawn. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"blo4v","text":"Cells are further differentiated for the final maturation in the N2B27 media without FGF2. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5cr9t","text":"3-5 times further passes might be required (1:2) until the complete loss of the precursor property. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Generation of hiPSC derived cortical astrocytes
